question: The Second Administrative Reforms Commission in its report entitled “Citizen Centric Administration: The Heart of Governance” (2009) identified how many barriers to good governance in India?
explanation:
The Second Administrative Reforms Commission in its report entitled “Citizen Centric Administration: The Heart of Governance” (2009) identified five barriers to good governance in India which are as follows-
1. Attitudinal Problems of the Civil Servants
2. Lack of Accountability
3. Red Tapism
4. Low levels of Awareness of the Rights and Duties of Citizens
5. Ineffective implementation of laws and rules
